alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:41AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A cluster of heavy showers will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, southeastern Lewis, east central Braxton, Upshur and southern Barbour Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 640 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of heavy showers along a line extending from Audra State Park to near Rock Cave. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Belington, Rock Cave, Junior, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Montrose, Pheasant Run, Alton, Kerens, Ellamore, Ireland, Tallmansville, Overhill, French Creek and Falls Mills. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 15 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Upshur
